comments.commentBody: That's all good but the issue for those of us who disagree (and the point of this article) is that his campaign promises were delusional solutions to exaggerated, poorly understood problems. And that the Republicans have jumped into bed with him in order to get their sanctimonious "agenda"passed" - another blind pursuit of"trickle down" nirvana. Other than that it's all good.

I share your bewilderment at how so many Americans can look at Trump and see something completely divorced from reality.
But then I look at my elderly mother. Highly intelligent, a lifelong Republican, and a very successful career woman at a time when that just didn't happen, she voted for Trump. She thinks he's "powerful".
The reason for this complete disconnect between reality and her perceptions? Two words: Fox News.
She says it tells her things she doesn't get anywhere else. It doesn't seem to occur to her that's because they're lies. I watched it with her once for a few minutes at her house and was almost sucked in, that's how effective their brainwashing is. I had to shake my head and remind myself I knew for a fact that what they were saying was a lie.
Unfortunately America is becoming a failed experiment. The question becomes how do you write a new constitution for the realities of today and the next 200 years? That's what blue America will have to decide when we secede.

Cohen focusses on Trump foreign policy, so we need to know the history:

The disasters in foreign policy have been by conservatives. Ending the Cold War was a bipartisan success. Gerald Ford objected that Reagan claimed too much credit. But the package of economic reforms in place by 1/93, that bankrupt Russia had to accept, was a disaster that accounts for Putin’s anger and opposition today.

Conservatives opposed the 3 policies that allowed us to win the Cold War: maintaining communication via UN membership, the Marshall Plan, and containment rather than escalation.

Eisenhower lied his way into the White House by claiming he had an alternative to Truman’s foreign policy. He didn’t. A democratic government in Iran was modeling itself after the West and offering oil companies a fair deal. Big Oil wanted it all, and thus wanted Mosaddegh overthrown. Truman rightly refused. Eisenhower allowed the Dulles/CIA coup, which began the mid-East violent militias, which took over Iran and are our main threat today.

The Bush/Cheney admin. was the greatest foreign policy disaster in American history. After the bombings in the late 90s, Obama ramped up the war on terror. Richard Clark, national security specialist for several admins., stated that Bush dropped that ball and refused to heed the warnings leading up to 9/11.

American courageously responded together to Pearl Harbor. 9/11 could have been the same. Instead, Bush/Cheney, shamefully, used it as grounds for partisan division.

Following an administration, there were never so many books published by leaders in history and foreign policy, across the spectrum, denouncing its foreign policy. You could have covered a table at Barnes & Noble with them. Dennis Ross’ “Statecraft” quotes leaders of the moderate Islamic nations – who we need to work with. They liked Clinton were able to work with the Clinton administration. They were not able to work with Bush/Cheney – a disaster for our foreign policy. Good luck for them working with Trump/Bannon going forward.

Bannon is to Trump like Cheney was to Bush, a misguiding, extremist, divisive, destructive influence.

Indiscriminately reducing the budget is no solution to trimming the fat.  If someone has lung cancer, you don't randomly stab them in the chest with the hope of obliterating the tumor.  Now the patient has two problems instead of one.  But what would we expect, having hired an actor from Grey's Anatomy to perform the surgery, instead of a competent physician?

This election will become a "key lesson of history" or there will be no history. The only way this gathering storm fails to be one of the great political scandals of all time is if Congress shuts down all investigations and casually accepts the Russian meddling, which appears to be the intention of a craven Republican Party. Otherwise, Trump-Putin and its authoritarian progeny will write the history, which will make no mention of Russian spycraft helping to push Donald over 370 electoral votes.

I fully support this comment.  Our 'Grey Lady', together with her respected print colleagues of America's newspapers and their associated investigators are now rising as our critical national bulwark, again.  The truth will save our nation.  As noted many decades ago by H. L. Mencken — 'Truth would quickly cease to be stranger than fiction, once we got as used to it.'

Just follow the money, and the witch's den will be found.  Hopefully, witch will be burned at the stake soon enough.  I would not be surprised if the removal of the Republican convention's platform plank for arming the Ukrainian army with lethal weapons was done at the request of Ambasador Kislyak - a Trump deal to be sure.
Folks seriously under sell that dossier's disturbing stories.  For me it was Carter Page making plans for shares in Russian gas afterward.

"The case of Konstantin V. Kilimnik, who was previously the Kiev manager of Mr. Manafort’s consulting company, Davis Manafort International, is more complicated. A dual citizen of Russia and Ukraine, Mr. Kilimnik worked years ago as a translator in the Russian military. "

Ukraine does not allow dual citizenship. Mr. Kilimnik is in violation of Ukrainian law.

Christina, the campaign is over, the elections have been held and President Obama and Ms Clinton have returned to the private sector. The fiasco that is the Trump administration belongs to trump, the GOP and the folks who voted him into office. Congratulations.
So much smoke and lies.

If the Republicans don't investigate soon, they'll be tarred with this Russian brush too. Right now, they could investigate Trump the Outsider, impeach, install Pence who is one of their own, and still get all the legislative and supreme court goodies they want. If they don't investigate, the whole house of cards will fall together.

What is stopping them? My money is that Putin has some nasty goods on some of our top Republican Congressmen. Some really juicy Christian values sins.
If this is a witch hunt, call me Dorothy. This is definitely worse than Watergate.

What should be asked : Why did advisors and appointees of Trump lie.

Follow this idea....need to lie about meetings which DID taken place between
Trump's team and Russian officials.....Need To Lie....by those who have been
found out as liars.......so ...what are these liars covering up...

Do Not Get Distracted by Trump and his Tweets....about anything....
Trump is the Chaos creator who would divert the investigation into the
Trump /Russian connections...so caveat...keep focused....and perhaps we
can rid ourselves of this dangerous and obviously mentally deranged President.

Trump's tweets are total tells.  I expect the press to sell me they have Prism metadata and GCHQ netted the Russians getting back to Vlad.  Sadly, the  characterization is going to be Russian. My understanding is Russians think Trump is a loose cannon, and now he might even blow up in their faces.
Calling Trump's manner 'his pugnacious style' is to invite ridicule. He has conducted himself like a thug and he is a habitual liar. That doesn't add up to 'pugnacity'.

If there were "nothing wrong" with these meetings between heaven knows how many of Trump's top aides, campaign advisors, and subsequent cabinet appointees, then why the initial insistent denials by Trump and "his people" who did meet with the Russians that they did NOT meet?

Then when the photos and evidence of meetings are unearthed, those caught "red-handed" proclaim the meeting was trivial and about "something else," not the Trump campaign and presidency.

This is like those videos of Trump saying something obnoxious that we saw and read about, while Trump claims "it never happened" and "I didn't say that," when the evidence is right there for all to hear and see.

Actually, Trump might have been smart to admit right away the meetings occurred because he was interested in exploring ways to have friendlier relations with Russia, and wouldn't we all want a more peaceful world? But Trump did not, and the question is WHY?

Time to clear the air, Republicans, or you are going to have a seriously tainted presidency on your watch. So let's see those Trump tax returns, and how about a bipartisan, independent investigation of the Trump-Russian connection, which if Trump is correct and not lying, should exonerate Trump--or maybe not!

The public has a right to know
Handing out the rubles.  Duh.
This is all about Russian oil and gas. Right Rex?
C.
I'm sure the Russians regret not standing by, without getting involved, and still have the satisfaction of watching the  US government implode of its own accord, or rather, discord.

Dumbest. Presidential Apprentice. Ever.
There, fixed it for you.
No one is forcing you to read it.
Hey, you know what?  People are allowed to speak to Russians!  We don't have a law against it.  What do we have a law against?  Lying to Congress.
Are you trying to be funny or did you really miss all of the taxpayer money spent on these events?

The Attorney General, during confirmation hearings, lied about contacts with the Russian ambassador during the campaign. Benghazi! Investigate! Benghazi! Hearings!

We do not need a National Security Advisor who is above the law. Sound familiar? LOCK HIM UP! LOCK HIM UP! LOCK HIM UP!

As governor of Indiana, the vice-president used a private email server to conduct state business. He is not fit for the office! Email-gate! Email-gate! It doesn’t matter if there was no law broken or no harm done. Resign now! Shame! Disgrace!

Breitbart is a credible news source. ‘Birth control makes women unattractive and crazy' ‘Science proves it: Fat shaming works’ ‘Political correctness protects Muslim rape culture’ Clearly, Bannon is the best choice to be a top Trump national security advisor. Dystopia! Apocalypse! Alt-white! Alt-might! Alt-whatever-I-say-is-right!

The president’s lies are truth, the truth, lies. The election is rigged! I won in a historic landslide! The election was rigged! Rigged! Rigged! Fake news! Russia! The press is the enemy! Why is everyone criticizing me? Poor Donald! Poor, poor, pitiful me!

Our fearless leaders, upholders of truth, fairness and the American way can’t figure out why much of the country doesn't trust them, doesn't like them, doesn't believe them, doesn't want them anywhere near the levers of power. Because they are lying hypocrites out to protect the interests of themselves, the rich and, apparently, the Russians. WE WON’T BE FOOLED AGAIN!
Richard19--I'm not so certain that millions of Americans won't be fooled again.  They have been trained to respond exactly the way that they do.

International banking has a dark side, and UBS has a sordid history. See links to NYT articles below. Tax evasion and money laundering are endemic in our monied elites, and international banking are an essential part of the system. UBS and Bank of Cyprus are major players. This is the world where Trump, Wilbur Ross, and not a few Russians, operate.

http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/24/business/global/at-ubs-its-the-culture...

http://www.nytimes.com/1991/08/12/business/world-class-fraud-bcci-pulled...

https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/06/us/panama-papers.html
